EdgesÔÉÅ

Base module for the edges of a polyhex

class polyhex.objects.edges.HexagonEdge(hexagon: Hexagon, start: HexagonVertex, end: HexagonVertex, index: int, feature: _Buffer | _SupportsArray[dtype[Any]] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype[Any]]] | complex | bytes | str | _NestedSequence[complex | bytes | str] = 'placeholder')ÔÉÅ

Bases: object

HexagonEdge class.

Parameters:

  • hexagon (Hexagon) ‚Äì the hexagon to which the edge‚Äôs belong

  • start (HexagonVertex) ‚Äì the start vertex

  • end (HexagonVertex) ‚Äì the end vertex

  • index (int) ‚Äì the edge‚Äôs index in the hexagon (0 to 5)

  • feature (ArrayLike) ‚Äì the edge‚Äôs feature

  • free (bool) ‚Äì Identifies if there is something on the edge. Defaults to False.

  • token (ArrayLike) ‚Äì Identifies what is on the edge. Defaults to None

distance(other, kwd='path')ÔÉÅ

Method to compute the distance between two edges.

Parameters:

  • other (HexagonEdge) ‚Äì other HexagonEdge

  • kwd (str, optional) ‚Äì kwd identifier of the distance. Defaults to ‚Äúpath‚Äù.

Raises:

NotImplementedError ‚Äì f‚ÄôThe distance method is only implemented for the kwd path.

Returns:

0 or 1

Return type:

int

draw(save=True)ÔÉÅ

The draw function is a convenience function that wraps the render function. It is used for standalone drawing and generates a figure which is saved based on the save boolean argument

Parameters:

save (bool, optional) ‚Äì _description_. Defaults to True.

property encodingÔÉÅ

it turns the string representation of the feature and the token into a list.

Returns:

vector encoding of the edge‚Äôs representation

Return type:

(list)

Type:

The encoding is an attribute of an edge

render(axes: Artist, **kwargs)ÔÉÅ

The render method is a public method. It is used for display and differs from draw as it requires a matplotlib.axe and returns a matplotlib.axe :param axes: matplotlib.Artist on which to draw :type axes: Artist :param kwargs: keyword dict that can replace the default rendering options defined in the assets.

Returns:

matplotlib.Artist on which the edge was rendered

Return type:

axes (Artist)

render_line(axes, **kwargs)ÔÉÅ

Method to render the body of an edge. It is used in conjunction with render_triangle that draws the background of an hexagon, in the triangle in the edge‚Äôs end, start and Hexagon‚Äôs centre node.

Parameters:

axes (Artist) ‚Äì matplotlib.Artist on which to draw

Returns:

matplotlib.Artist on which the edge was rendered

Return type:

axes (Artist)

render_triangle(axes, **kwargs)ÔÉÅ

Method to render the background of an hexagon, in the triangle in the edge‚Äôs end, start and Hexagon‚Äôs centre node. It is used in conjunction with render_line that draws the edge‚Äôs body

Parameters:

axes (Artist) ‚Äì matplotlib.Artist on which to draw

Returns:

matplotlib.Artist on which the edge was rendered

Return type:
